reviewText: This game is entirely based on timing your shots right. The game that comes to mind first when playingatorb" is the game "Zuma" without the combos. Atorb is a game where you have multipe rings that correspond with a color
date: you then have orbs or balls that you must get ONTO those color corresponding rings. You have an orange orb you must get it onto the orange ring
recommended: you have a blue orb you must get it onto the blue ring. It is a fun and simple game that can test your patience at times (:\n\nTo go into a depth a little more there are 3 difficulty settings easy
hoursPlayed:
normal and hard.
-Easy / You can shot the colored orb onto the correct ring in any area to pass the level
-Normal / You must shoot the orbs into predetermined spots on each ring (no punishment for missing)
-Hard / You must shoot the orbs into predetermined spots on each ring WITHOUT missing
voteText:
if you miss you must restart the entire level.

I think the game so far from what ive played is fun the music is soothing and a nice color scheme. I purchased the game for 2.50 USD and the full price is 3.00. Not an expensive game and I think its well worth the money!

Solid 9/10 for what it is."

reviewText: The first few stages are easy enough to help you understand the mechanics and get accustomed with the gameplay, but things get trickier and trickier as you move on. More orbits are added later on, and their speed increases as well. In fact, it becomes quite challenging after a while, since your reflexes and coordination are put to the test when everything is spinning really fast.

reviewText: Repetitive but fun activities can be exactly what you need after a tough day, or even on a boring day. Playing atorb might look like solid boredom from the outside, but once you start playing yourself and see just how addictive the whole thing is, you might see its purpose. There are many examples like this, so it’s up to everyone to choose one game that helps them relax. atorb do it right.

reviewText: atorb is an indie game that looks about as basic as possible, yet it’s anything but that once you start playing it. In short, your goal is to shoot colored circle onto the correct orbits, while avoiding the differently colored blobs that are already spinning around. Naturally, this sounds a lot like Zuma, but there are key differences that make the experience unique and quite pleasant.\n
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: That’s not enough to keep you busy for a long time, on the other hand. Thankfully, the game features a few other gimmicks as well, such as three different difficult levels. Hence, more mechanics are added if you decide to raise the bar. As an example, the highest difficulty demands that you shoot each circle in a specific spot, otherwise the whole level resets and you have to try again.
